user_regex = r"(@\w{1,15})"
hashtag_replace_regex = "#(\w{1,})"
url_regex = r"((https?|ftp|file):\/{2,3})+([-\w+&@#/%=~|$?!:,.]*)|(www.)+([-\w+&@#/%=~|$?!:,.]*)"
email_regex = r"[\w.-]+@[\w.-]+\.[a-zA-Z]{1,}"
i_regex = r"i "

def text_preprocess(data):
            # Remove @Mention
    data=(data.withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), user_regex, "")) 
            # Remove #Hashtag 
            .withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), hashtag_replace_regex, "$1"))
            # Remove URL 
            .withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), url_regex, "")) 
            # Remove Email t
            .withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), email_regex, ""))
            # Remove character and number
            .withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), "[^a-zA-Z]", " "))
            # Remove abundant space
            .withColumn("text",f.regexp_replace(f.col("text"), " +", " "))
            # Remove begin and end space
            .withColumn("text",f.trim(f.col("text")))
            # Lowercase all
            .withColumn("text",f.lower(f.col("text")))
            # Keep text
            .filter(f.col("text") != ""))
    
    return data

regexTokenizer = RegexTokenizer(inputCol="text", outputCol="words", pattern="\\W")

# Step: Stopwords removing
stopwords_remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="words1", 
                                     stopWords=StopWordsRemover.loadDefaultStopWords("english"))

# Step: tf-idf
hashtf = HashingTF(numFeatures=2**16, inputCol="words1", outputCol='tf')

idf = IDF(inputCol='tf', outputCol="features", minDocFreq=5) #minDocFreq: remove sparse terms

from textblob import TextBlob

def get_polarity(s):
    return TextBlob(s).sentiment.polarity

udf1 = udf(get_polarity, FloatType())

predictions_post = predictions.withColumn('sentiment', udf1(col('text')))

predictions_post = predictions_post.withColumn('polarity',when(col('sentiment')<0, 0).when(col('sentiment')==0, 2)
                                               .otherwise(4))

predictions_post = predictions_post.withColumn('prob', col('probability').cast("string").substr(3,4).cast("float"))
